definition: to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
old variant of 刊[kan1]/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend

sentences.english: The young man sitting between Mary and John is the editor of our campus newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 坐在玛丽和约翰之间的年轻人是我们校刊的编辑。

sentences.english: Suppose you write an interesting and original story for your school magazine.
sentences.chinese: 假设你为校刊写了篇有趣又富创意的文章。

sentences.english: I enjoyed reading your articles in the school magazine.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢读你在校刊上的文章。

sentences.english: The yearbook will be published on May 20.
sentences.chinese: 本学年校刊将于五月二十日出刊。

sentences.english: Robbie: I'm writing a story for the high-school paper.
sentences.chinese: 我正在为高中校刊写篇东西。

sentences.english: Posters produced, School magazine published, Web design .
sentences.chinese: 海报制作，校刊发表，网页设计。

sentences.english: I enjoyed reading your "What's cool?" article in the school magazine.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴在校刊上读到你写的“什么最酷”的文章。

sentences.english: I like your articles in the school magazine.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢你在校刊上的文章。怎么做？

sentences.english: Lucy wanted to write an article on detectives for the school newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 露西想为校刊写一篇与侦探有关的文章。

sentences.english: I'm writing a story for the high-school paper.
sentences.chinese: 我正在为高中校刊写篇东西。

sentences.english: In college, I was editor of the World News section of my university’s paper.
sentences.chinese: 就学期间我是大学校刊世界新闻的编辑。

definition: blackboard bulletin with short news items written on it (can usually be found in factories, schools etc)
to start publishing/to found a journal
